AODCore.input

Describes the input of the current state of the Engine

enum Mouse_Bind: int;
These represent SDL_ScanCodes. These are preferable to just calling mouse functions because these are bindeable from the config INI

X1
(also known as "mouse4")

X2
(also known as "mouse5")

ubyte* keystate;
The current state of the keyboard (and mouse). Use either Mouse_Bind or SDL_SCANCODE for index.

Example:
  if ( keystate [ SDL_SCANCODE_A ] ) Output("A pressed");


bool R_LMB();
Returns:
if the Left Mouse button is pressed

bool R_RMB();
Returns:
if the Right Mouse button is pressed

bool R_MMB();
Returns:
if the Middle Mouse button is pressed

bool R_MX1();
Returns:
if MouseX1 (mouse4) button is pressed

bool R_MX2();
Returns:
if MouseX2 (mouse5) button is pressed

float R_Mouse_X(bool camoffset);
Params:
bool camoffset Whether to offset the position of the mouse with the camera

Returns:
The position of the mouse on the x-axis

float R_Mouse_Y(bool camoffset);
Params:
bool camoffset Whether to offset the position of the mouse with the camera

Returns:
The position of the mouse on the y-axis
